2) I have determined that the sum of two and two is: `r 2+2`

3) 

```{r, starwars-plot, fig.cap = "Star Wars character mass vs height"}
library(tidyverse)
ggplot(starwars,aes(x=height,y=mass)) + geom_point()

```

Look at Figure \@ref(fig:starwars-plot)!

4) 
```{r, starwars-table, fig.cap = "Star Wars mass and unique species by planet"}

head(starwars %>%
  group_by(homeworld) %>%
  summarise(total_mass = sum(mass),no_species = n_distinct(species))%>%
  knitr::kable(caption = "a bad table"),10)

```
That was fun.  Now look at Table \@ref(fig:starwars-table)!

```{r piccy, echo=FALSE, fig.cap="A caption", out.width = '100%'}
knitr::include_graphics("star_wars_new.jpg")
```

Figure \@ref(fig:piccy) is a nice picture!
